intro: Rodriguezia estradae, commonly known as the El Salvador wax tree, is a species of flowering plant native to El Salvador. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that help it conserve water in its dry habitat. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in the spring. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
